title: Facts about condoms?
content:
Condoms are sheaths or coverings that fit over man’s erect penis, essential in preventing unwanted pregnancy and protecting against STDs, and HIV if correctly and consistently used. 

Most are made of latex rubber. Condoms work by forming a barrier that keeps sperm out of the vagina, preventing pregnancy. Also keep infections in semen or in penis or in the vagina from infecting the other partner. 

 - Check the expiry date on the package. 
 - Before sex, have it close by. 
 - Tear open the package carefully. 
 - Do not use fingernails, teeth, or anything that can damage the condom.
 - As soon as your penis is hard, put the condom on. 
 - Squeeze the tip of the condom to keep air out. 
 - Unroll the condom down to the base of your penis. 
 - After sex, hold the rim of the condom. 
 - Take the penis out of the vagina before it gets soft, being careful not to spill the semen on your partner. 
 - Discard the used condom in a latrine or burn it and wash your hands.
 - Condoms require correct use every time you have sex in order to be effective.
 - Condoms are available in shops, pharmacies, clinics, hospitals, health centres and form Community Reproductive health workers.
